title: Weekend Trip
description: Donna wants the family to go away on a long overdue vacation. But will Dr. Stone's patients let them get away for even a weekend?

title: Pardon My Gloves
description: Donna is vying for a role in an amateur stage production and doesn't get along so well with the director. Things get worse when Jeff comes home with a black eye, given to him by the director's son.

title: The Hike
description: An emergency forces Dr. Stone to pull out of an overnight camping trip with Jeff and his friends. Donna volunteers to take over and, once in the woods, comes up with an ingenious solution to her inexperience.

title: The Male Ego
description: After Mary writes a prize winning essay on motherhood that has everybody praising Donna, Jeff starts to feel unappreciated.

title: The Football Uniform
description: Jeff has his heart set on getting a football uniform. Alex and Donna tell him he must save his money to pay for it. But when they discover his picture will be in the newspaper will they give in and buy it for him anyway?

title: The Foundling
description: Someone leaves a baby on the front doorstep. Alex, who thinks the baby should be turned over to the authorities, fears the family is becoming too attached to it.

title: Three-Part Mother
description: In the series' pilot, Donna has a bit of a problem: how can she attend Jeff's basketball game, Mary's initiation into her girl's club and her husband's speech - all at the same time?

title: Change Partners and Dance
description: Mary has a crush on another student but he doesn't notice her. Donna suggests she invite him home, which Mary does, but it's Donna that gets all of his attention.

title: Dough Re Mi
description: Donna's plan for a fund raiser goes awry until Jeff agrees to have dinner with a girl.

title: Guest in the House
description: A young runaway boy spends Thanksgiving with the Stone family.

title: The Baby Contest
description: Donna gets stuck with organizing a baby beauty contest. And who would be a better judge of a baby contest than a pediatrician?

title: The Beaded Bag
description: It's Donna's birthday and she claims there's nothing she wants as a present. Alex isn't so sure she telling the truth.

title: The Busy Body
description: Uncle Fred, Donna's uncle, swoops in for an unexpected visit and immediately gets into everybody's business, with unexpected results.

title: A Very Merry Christmas
description: Donna is frantically making last-minute preparations for Christmas and is vexed when no one seems to care for the fruitcakes she is giving for Christmas presents. Her Christmas spirit is rejuvenated when she learns that no one has planned a Christmas party for the children who cannot leave their ward and return home for the holiday. With the help of the hospital handyman, she tries to rectify the oversight.

title: Mary's Double Date
description: Mary has three potential dates to the prom. She can't decide if she should go with the left tackle, or the right tackle, or just plain ole Buzz.

title: Jeff's Double Life
description: When Jeff hurts his arm when he was someplace he shouldn't have been at, he tries to avoid telling his parents by going to the other pediatrician in town.

title: Nothing But the Truth
description: David Barker, who had previously spent Thanksgiving with the Stones, decides he would like to visit them again. He tells them that it's his birthday even though it's actually not for several more months.

title: It's the Principle of the Thing
description: Mr. Popkin doesn't have the money to pay for his son's expensive treatment and he won't allow Alex to do it for free. Donna figures she can hire him for household chores instead.

title: Jeff vs. Mary
description: Jeff starts to think that his parents prefer Mary more than they do him.

title: Have Fun
description: Mary thinks her first date with Herbie was a disaster until she hears how her parents first date went.

title: Donna Plays Cupid
description: Donna decides that bachelor Burt Boland needs to meet her friend Ceil. The date goes well until Ceil's old boyfriend shows up.

title: Love Thy Neighbor
description: Alex & Donna help friends celebrate their 20th wedding anniversary. Celia and Wilbur have been arguing all day over Wilbur's secretary because Celia thinks he pays too much attention to her. Celia leaves Wilbur after the party.

title: The Report Card
description: Jeff's report card is less than his parents expect and they make him stay home to study. But Jeff finds a way around being grounded.

title: Boys Will Be Boys
description: Young David Barker returns to the Stones' home for another visit. He has a secret and the stress of hiding it leads him to a very odd dream.

title: The Ideal Wife
description: Donna comes to the conclusion that she's too nice for her own good. She decides to be more assertive to see what people think then.

title: Mary's Campaign
description: Mary is running to be the vice-president of her class, but Donna doesn't like the way she, or rather her campaign manager, is running her campaign.

title: The Flowered Print Dress
description: After visiting a newlywed couple Donna begins to wonder if her marriage is in a rut.

title: April Fool
description: Buzz Berry, Mary's favorite rock singer, is coming to town for a show. On the night of the show, however, Buzz comes down with a bad case of the measles, and is taken to the Stones' house to be treated by Alex, and is forced to stay there for a few days to recuperate. When word leaks out that he is staying there, the Stones' house is besieged by his adoring fans.

title: The Parting of the Ways
description: Mary's friend Babs is upset because she thinks her parents are breaking up. Donna & Alex decide to help the Keppler's save their marriage. However, Bab's was wrong - her parents are not breaking up, so the Stone's effort to help backfires.

title: The Hero
description: Biff, Alex's old college roommate, comes to visit. Everyone's opinion of Biff is based upon his past glory and Biff is tired of living in the past.

title: Do You Trust Your Child?
description: Donna adopts the belief that children are capable of making good decisions on their own. Her beliefs are tested when Mary starts dating an annoying boy Donna doesn't like.

title: The Grateful Patient
description: When the Stones get the chance to triple their money in a land deal, Donna and the kids start planning on how they'll spend the windfall. Alex urges caution to no avail.

title: The Testimonial
description: When Donna finds out a favorite doctor plans to retire, she decides he should have a retirement dinner with testimonials from his patients and peers. As plans progress, Donna finds out Dr Jason does not want to retire regardless of his age.

title: Miss Lovelace Comes to Tea
description: Donna's work in a charity campaign leaves her with no time for housework. When they decide to hire a maid, they discover the woman they hire isn't really able to cook or clean.

title: Tomorrow Comes Too Soon
description: After Donna and Alex finally manage to arrange a weekend alone for just the two of them, Donna spends the whole time pining for the kids.

title: Advice to Young Lovers
description: Mary has boy problems when she and her girlfriends try to one boy jealous of another. Mary thinks the plan backfires and gives up on all boys. Donna gives advice on how to straighten everything out.

title: Operation Deadbeat
description: Jeff borrowed money. Alex wants Jeff to learn the value of money and pay it back. When Donna tries to get Alex to forgive the debt, they discuss the patients who still owe Alex for his services. Donna decides to collect on those bills.

title: That's Show Business
description: Mary is excited to be included in a school play. Kenny is a classmate who also was accepted, but he dropped out since he stutters. Mary convinces him to remain in the play. Kenny stays, and is paired with Mary for a dance routine.

title: Sleep No More My Lady
description: Donna & Alex fly to New York where Alex will give a speech at a medical convention. Donna is so excited for Alex that she cannot sleep. After going on excitement for a full day, Alex gives her a tranquilizer to help her get some rest.

title: A Penny Earned
description: After completing a newspaper quiz Donna learns she gets a perfect score for being thrifty, which impels her to become a spendthrift.

title: A Friend Indeed
description: Doug is a new friend of Jeff's. Doug's mother praises Donna for having such a wonderful, perfect child when her child is noisy and impolite. Donna knows otherwise, so she invites the mother over to see Doug is the same as Jeff.

title: The First Child
description: After a nervous couple have their first baby, Alex can hardly get any sleep or spend any time with the family because of their constant cries for help.

title: Going Steady
description: Mary wants Jeff to be more friendly with a girl so that she will have an excuse to meet her older brother. Jeff might be willing to do so - if the price is right.

title: The Neighborly Gesture
description: New neighbors move in next to the Stones, and Jeff finds the man interesting. He tells his father all the great things the man can do, and Alex finds himself getting jealous.

title: Nothing Like a Good Book
description: A neighbor invites the Stones to dinner with a group of friends. She spends the evening bragging about the intellectual books she reads. Donna gets talked into joining a book club and has one week to read War and Peace.

title: Flowers for the Teacher
description: Jeff complains the teacher at school does not like any of the students because she is so strict. Donna visits the teacher and finds she is actually afraid of the students as it is her first teaching experience. Donna finds a way to fix it.

title: All Mothers Worry
description: Jeff's friend Phillip changes at Jeff's home after the football practices. Donna finds out and realizes Phillip's mother does not know he is playing football. The mother is afraid her boy will get hurt. Donna talks to the mother.

title: Jeff Joins a Club
description: A new kid in town follows Jeff around all the time, no matter how many times Jeff tries to lose him. Donna wants Jeff to be nice to Walter. When Jeff & Walter try to join a club, the group denies Jeff since he is a friend of Walter.

title: The Punishment
description: Donna is upset with Mary and Jeff arrive home late and reprimands them. Alex comes home and it is all smiles for dad. Donna & Alex try to work out a plan for punishing Mary and Jeff without either of them seeming like the bad parent.

title: A Difference of Opinion
description: Donna is forced to accept a dinner invitation with a couple that neither she nor Alex enjoy. This causes an argument between them whether to go or not go, and they try to find their fight from Mary and Jeff.

title: The Homecoming Dance
description: Mary is invited to a dance at a nearby college with a blind date, and she would have to stay overnight in the dormitory. The Stone's agree, but only because they are going to drive her to and from. Jeff gets to go camping with a friend.

title: Lucky Girl
description: It seems as if all Donna's friends are complimenting her on having such a wonderful husband, and that she is such a lucky girl. Donna wonders if they think she is not good enough for Alex and that it was just pure luck she got such a guy.

title: The Broken Spirit
description: Jeff's been causing problems lately, so Alex has a talk with him about behaving. Jeff's attitude changes, and everyone thinks it is because of the talk. However, Jeff causes a problem with a neighbor and is actually just feeling guilty.

title: The Secret
description: Mary's friend Carol is engaged to Matthew, but does not want her family to know. Carol asks Mary to hide the ring and have her boyfriend's letters sent to the Stone residence. Donna and Alex start to wonder about Mary's secret and the mail.

title: The New Mother
description: David Barker has run away from his boarding school and returns again to the Stone family. David's father is getting remarried, and David is afraid he will have to stay in the boarding school instead of being with his father and new mother.

title: Just a Housewife
description: Stopped for an interview by a gimmicky showman at a grocery store, Donna makes a stand for women who often say they are just a housewife. Stay at home mothers are more than just stay at home people.

title: The Free Soul
description: Dan, a friend of Alex's father visits the Stones and tells the family of his exciting travels. Jeff gets caught up in the excitement and wants to travel the world with Dan.

title: The First Quarrel
description: Friends of Alex and Donna's, who have only been married a few years, have their first quarrel. Donna helps Alice understand how to handle a quarrel. Alex tells Donna she should try to keep out of the situation, but then he helps Jim.

title: A Place to Go
description: Donna's woman club is looking for a project. When they find the neighborhood children are playing in an abandoned building, the women decide to build a proper gathering place for the children.

title: A Night to Howl
description: Mary discovers poetry, and then worries that her mother and father lost their passion for life and things are boring for them. For a change of pace, Donna and Alex decide to go on a trip during a school night. It does not go as planned.

title: The Editorial
description: Jeff is promoted to editor of his school newspaper. His first editorial is to speak out against too much homework. It is a good piece, but the teachers do not think it should be published.

title: The Gentle Dew
description: When it seems Mary and Jeff are not always doing their homework or chores, Alex decides to lay down the rules and make sure everyone sticks to them. Donna thinks the rules are a bit harsh.

title: The Fatal Leap
description: Alex is invited to a wedding of his former college roommate who had some wild nights and lots of dates. Alex is also invited to the bachelor party. Donna is worried about what might happen.

title: The Perfect Pitch
description: Jeff is excited to try out for the track team and even plans to practice to get in shape for the tryouts. But then Donna finds out he has perfect pitch in music and thinks he should take music lessons and learn the trumpet.

title: Pickles for Charity
description: The Woman's Medical Auxiliary host a dance event. While the dance was a success, raising funds was not. The Auxiliary decides to hold another event to raise money to pay for the dance. Donna decides to sell homemade pickles.

title: Mary's Growing Pain
description: Mary's ski trip with friends gets canceled and she is disappointed. However, when an intern from the hospital visits Alex at his home, her mood lightens up immediately.

title: Alex Runs the House
description: Jeff visits his uncle and aunt on their farm by himself. Donna is worried and misses Jeff so much, she goes to the farm as well. Alex and Mary have to take care of the house and meals while she is gone.

title: The Career Woman
description: An old friend of Donna's comes to visit. She is now a well-known fashion designer, and about to marry a doctor. She wants to know what it is like to be married to a doctor. Donna thinks the life of a career woman is exciting.

title: Jeff, the Financial Genius
description: Jeff wants an advance on his allowance to buy items for his latest project. When that fails, he tries borrowing from everyone. Alex finds out he owes a lot of people money, and puts Jeff on a strict budget until he pays everyone back.

title: Mary's Crusade
description: Mary's friend Ellen is very smart at school, but plain looking. No one asks her out. Mary decides to give Ellen a makeover to show the boys in school that Ellen is just as pretty as she is smart.

title: The First Time We Met
description: Donna & Alex have different memories of how they originally met.

title: The Gossip
description: Donna's friend Kay tells her that she is pregnant, but to keep it a secret. Donna only tells one other friend, who tells another, who tells another, etc. Kay is upset because she might lose her job if her boss finds out she is pregnant.

title: Love's Sweet Awakening
description: A neighbor's child returns home for a visit while on break from military school. Since Petie was a favorite friend of Mary and Jeff, he visits the Stones. Petie is smitten by Mary's grown-up looks.

title: The Wedding Present
description: Donna purchases an expensive art object and is to tell Alex about it, so it gets hidden. When Alex's Aunt Lettie calls to say she is visiting, Alex says they have to put out her wedding gift. Alex finds the statue and puts it out.

title: Cool Cat
description: A seemingly stray cat follows Jeff home, and the family votes to allow him to stay. Turns out the cat is female, and slowly brings her family of kittens into the house. Jeff & Mary give the kittens away just as Alex finds they are pedigree.

title: Weekend
description: The Stones decide to go away to somewhere different for an extended weekend, but the actual accommodation are nothing like what they saw in the brochure.

title: The Mystery Woman
description: While eating lunch with Mary at a restaurant, a woman approaches Donna as a long lost friend and invites Donna & Alex to dinner the next day at her home. Donna cannot remember who the woman is.

title: Donna Decorates
description: Donna has her kitchen remodeled and new appliances installed. Then she needs to refinish an arm chair which leads to the other furniture look drab. Also, Alex's birthday is the next day, and no one can think of a gift to get him.

title: The Love Letter
description: The Stones hire a handyman to do repairs around the house. The handyman asks Jeff to help him write a love letter to his girlfriend. Donna finds Jeff's practice letter laying around, and thinks Jeff is in love with a classmate.

title: How the Other Side Lives
description: Mary returns home from a weekend visit with a friend and just raves about how wonderful her friend's home is. Donna begins to feel their own home is a shack compared to the other home.

title: Alex's Twin
description: Mary meets a boy at school that reminds her of her father. She thinks Elroy looks like what her father might have looked like at that age. Donna and Alex cannot wait to see Elroy and how much he must look like Alex.

title: Worried, Anyone?
description: Mary is going out with Scotty in a car he built himself. When Donna and Alex find the parts of the car are from cars that have been in wrecks, they are worried.

title: Higher Learning
description: The school issues an intelligence test to the students, and Jeff gets a score that ranks him as a genius. Alex and Donna have to decide to send him to a special school. Jeff fails the entrance exam for the school.

title: Never Marry a Doctor
description: Alex and Donna discuss the problems of having a doctor in the family who is often called away at all times of the day.

title: It Only Hurts When I Laugh
description: Alex wakes up one night with pain and a high temperature. He is checked into the hospital and becomes a difficult patient.

title: The Model Daughter
description: Mary decides she wants to be a model. She wins a scholarship to a modeling school, but finds it expensive to live the life of a model.

title: Decisions, Decisions, Decisions
description: Mary has a bad case of indecisiveness and asks Donna for advice on clothes, errands, boys, and more. She ends up having a date with two boys.

title: Donna Goes to a Reunion
description: Donna is looking forward to attending her college reunion. When Alex hears about a former boyfriend, he decides to go with her. The women decide to reenact their cheer-leading cheer and Donna gets a black eye the day of the dance.

title: Someone Is Watching
description: Jeff's friend Gordy shows off with his new scooter. Gordy accidentally hits a tree and has a small injury. Gordy pretends his leg really hurts so he can stay at the Stone's resident. Donna finds out why he does not really want to go home.

title: The Lean and Hungry Look
description: Mary wants Jeff to pay her back from a loan so she can buy a new sweater. Since there was no due date given, he decides to drag it out. Donna goes on a diet to lose a few pounds.

title: Character Building
description: Donna gets upset with Mary and Jeff starting projects and never finishing them, losing track of items they used last, and more. Donna decides to make them mend their ways.

title: World's Greatest Entertainer
description: Jeff seems to be in a slump by causing things to happen without realizing what is going on. The rest of the family start to praise him for anything he does and he starts to feel better. Jeff decides to try out for the school play.

title: Variations on a Theme
description: Donna is tired of everyone using the piano as a drop area for their belongings. Alex suggests selling it. Donna arranges for a pick up, but then Mary puts up a fight to save it. Donna learns the reason why Mary really wants to save it.

title: The Stones Go to Hollywood
description: When Donna, Mary, and Jeff find that Alex is going to Hollywood for a doctor's conference, they insist on going with him. They plan on two fast days of sight seeing and star gazing, but they mostly sit in the hotel due to heavy rains.

title: Donna Directs a Play
description: Mary and her classmates are rehearsing for a school play, but the director steps out at the last minute. Donna steps in to be the director.

title: Trip to Nowhere
description: When a friend of Jeff's brags about going on a camping trip with his father, Jeff says Alex is taking him camping also. Since Alex is unavailable, Donna decides to take him. Before the trip, Jeff finds out his friend is not going camping.

title: The Geisha Girl
description: Donna meets the wife of a new doctor at the hospital. Since she is Japaneses, Donna decides she needs to learn some American customs and way of life.

title: The Busy People
description: When Donna finds her and Alex's friends stay busy with music lessons and dance lessons, she decides she and Alex have to take some kind of lesson's together. Donna signs them up for painting lessons so they can spend more time together.

title: Tony Martin Visits
description: Donna gets a parking ticket and does not think she is in the wrong. She decides to fight it in traffic court. While there, singer Tony Martin is also in court fighting a ticket. He decides to fight his ticket because Donna is fighting hers.

title: Aunt Belle's Earrings
description: Donna wants to go to the Founders Ball but Alex does not. Alex is struggling with Mr Greevy for financing of a new clinic. Greevy wants more money. Donna's Aunt Bell visits. Turns out, Bell and Greevy know each other from years past.

title: The Poodle Parlor
description: Donna and her friend Madeline decide to open a poodle parlor in town, and the husbands think it is funny because they do not know how to run a business. The women are determined, but find out there are only seven poodles in town.

title: Mary's Heart Throb
description: While Mary is babysitting a young child, the older brother comes home and tells Mary he left college. The Stones try to help him determine which career path he wants to follow.

title: Donna's Helping Hand
description: The Board of Health Director retires, and Donna campaigns to have Alex nominated. It would mean he could have regular office hours. Alex enjoys his job as a pediatrician.

title: The Merry Month of April
description: Alex realizes it is the day before income taxes are due, and he rushes to prepare the papers.

title: Music Hath Charms
description: While putting on a puppet show, Jeff accidentally breaks a treasured gift that Donna purchased for Alex - a musical tobacco jar. Alex is glad it is broken because he did not like the music.

title: Let's Look at Love
description: Mary is upset when she learns that two boys tossed a coin to see who would take her out. Mary does not want to be considered a pawn and decides to give up on boys.

title: For Better or Worse
description: Alex and his friends plan a fishing trip, and the others say they have to ask permission from their wives to go. Alex says he does not have to ask for permission - until he tells her he is going.

title: Jeff, the Treasurer
description: Jeff is elected class treasurer and brings home all the money in the class fund. Alex and Donna warn him to be careful, but of course Jeff misplaces the money and has to find it before the next class meeting.

title: The Good Guys and the Bad Guys
description: Donna & Alex encourage Jeff to join the church choir. He does, but then he is teased by his classmates. Jeff takes up weight lifting to muscle up in case of a fight.

title: Military School
description: Herbie's friend who is in the military visits. Herbie suggests that Mary and he take the friend with them to the school dance. Mary does not want to, but when she sees the handsome friend, she changes her mind.

title: Mary's Driving Lesson
description: Mary asks Scotty to teach her how to drive. He starts out by telling her all about how cars work, what types of cars there are, what is great about cars, etc. Mary just wants to learn how to drive.

title: The Mustache
description: Alex returns from a hunting trip with a mustache and beard. He decides to keep the mustache which receives mixed reviews from the family. Mary has a crush with a new boy at school who has different views from all her friends.

title: Mary's Little Lambs
description: While Donna is out of town, Mary takes over the house in a negative way. Alex allows her to have a teen party, and on Saturday to open the house to a baby-sitting service.

title: One Starry Night
description: Mary's careless driving leads to an unexpected romantic evening with a young pop singer, followed by heartbreak when he leaves for the army.

title: A Rose Is a Rose
description: Jeff turned in a terrible paper to his English class that has his teacher and parents upset at his grammar. He is told he has to redo the assignment - on the same day as the father/son baseball game.

title: The Close Shave
description: Jeff starts to grow facial hair and buys every type of shaving and grooming supplies available. He also decided he is grown enough to use Mother and Father instead of Mom and Dad. He wants to contribute to the household income and get a job

title: Mouse at Play
description: Donna's friend is upset because her husband never notices anything new. Donna realizes Alex can also sometimes be unobservant. While Alex is away at a medical convention, Donna changes her hair color to see if he notices when he returns.

title: The Monster
description: The discovery of mysterious animal prints in the backyard leads to a harrowing night for Donna, her children, and a temporary addition to the family.

title: New Girl in Town
description: Mary offers to pay Jeff's way to a movie if he takes a new girl in the neighborhood to the movie with him. Her interest is in the new guy in the neighborhood.

title: One of Those Days
description: Alex has a frustrating day where everything goes wrong and decides to go home. Donna convinces him that they should go on a picnic to relax, but even the relaxing trip has problems.

title: All Is Forgiven
description: Donna & Alex have dinner with their friends Millie & Jack, but the evening turns into an argument between their friends. When the friends decide to split up, Donna suggests they adopt a child to love and heal the family.

title: The Electrical Storm
description: Jeff is suspended from school when he and his friends pull a prank that causes pandemonium during class. Alex and Donna suspect something's wrong but wait until Jeff is ready to come to them.

title: The Paper Tycoon
description: Jeff starts a paper route and realizes it is not as easy as it seems.

title: Private Tutor
description: Mary is excited about an upcoming dance party and hopes the new boy in school will invite her. Donna says she cannot go until her grade improves. Mary's new tutor is the new boy in school.

title: Alex, the Professor
description: Donna talks Alex into being a speaker for a woman's group about child psychology. Alex gives the speech and then decides he is going to put his theories in practice with Mary and Jeff.

title: The Fabulous O'Hara
description: Alex's patient lives with his grandfather. Mr O'Hara thinks Alex is undercharging and says he should charge more for his services. Jeff decides to use that fact and become his father's agent.

title: Way of a Woman
description: Scotty breaks a skiing date with Mary. Donna see Mary's disappointment and asks Alex to take her on a trip to Chicago. Special arrangements are made Scotty comes into the picture and tells Mary he can go on the skiing trip.

title: A Very Bright Boy
description: Johnny Crawford stars as the son of Donna's college roommate. According to an IQ Test, he is not very smart, but the Stone family finds him to be highly intelligent. They find out why his mother thinks he is not smart.

title: The Toughest Kid in School
description: Alex and Mary want Jeff to help the new kid in school get acquainted with school and friends. Jeff finds him annoying as the kid tries to prove he is better and tougher than others.

title: Dr. Stone and His Horseless Carriage
description: Alex is excited over his new car - an antique 1910 car. He drives it around town, causing people to talk.

title: For Angie with Love
description: Jeff tries to match a rich boy's gift of a Cashmere sweater to Angie who he is sweet on. He also sings "She Can't Find her Keys."

title: Aloha, Kimi
description: When the daughter of a family friend is paralyzed in a surfing accident, Alex is asked to fly to Hawaii to assist in her treatment. Alex and Donna get to know the Doctors and Nurses of the Pacific View Clinic.

title: Donna's Prima Donna
description: Mary considers skipping college to pursue a singing career. Donna is skeptical until she hears her sing "Johnny Angel."

title: Explorer's Ten
description: After listening to a talk on space travel, Jeff and his Explorer friends decide to raise money to buy a telescope. Once they have the money, Jeff thinks there's a better way to use it.

title: The New Office
description: Alex considers moving his practice out of the house and into an office downtown. Everyone is excited about the idea at first but then start to get second thoughts.

title: The Golden Trap
description: Mary is confident she can handle Jeff and the house when her parents go out of town. But then the water heater goes on the fritz and all of her friends drop in for an impromptu party.

title: Free Flight
description: After Donna sends a telegram complaining about an airline's service directly to its president, the airline gives her and Alex two free tickets. Unfortunately, they come with several strings attached.

title: The Wide Open Spaces
description: This episode was a back door pilot that introduced the Stones' neighbors, the Adams, whom Donna and Dr. Alex Stone pay a visit after the family moved from Hilldale to a farm in the country to escape the rigors of living in the city. The episode stars William Windom ("The Farmer's Daughter") as David Adams and Patricia Breslin ("I Saw What You Did") as Millie Adams, David's long suffering wife who loathed life on a farm. Two juvenile brothers from Canada, Steve Barringer and his little brother Leslie, starred as the couple's two sons. The new series was to be a fish-out-of-water situation comedy to replace The Donna Reed Show after Reed had announced her intentions to retire from television. The new series was produced by Reed's then husband, Tony Owen, who also produced The Donna Reed Show. The episodes was not picked up as a series after Reed decided to not to retire and The Donna Reed Show continued to air for four additional seasons. The concept of city folk moving to the country was used again by rival studio Filmways as "Green Acres".

title: The Fireball
description: As Jeff and Angie rehearse their lines for a school play, they reminisce about the way they first met. They both get angry with each other and wonder if they can continue their participation in the play.

title: Once Upon a Timepiece
description: When Alex's watch seems to be shot, Donna buys an antique one to replace it. After they discover an inscription on it Donna decides to track down the original owner, with surprising results.

title: Hilldale 500
description: Jeff is interested in entering go-cart races. He does not have the money to do it, nor does he have his mother's approval.

title: Winner Takes All
description: Jeff and his friend Moose enjoy playing school baseball, but Moose's father keeps pushing Moose to do more on the field. Alex decides to talk to the overbearing father about teens and sports.

title: Skin Deep
description: A friend sets Mary up on a blind date, and she is looking forward to it. When she learns the boy is not attractive, she wants to cancel the date.

title: The Fortune Teller
description: Donna is coaxed into being a fortune teller at the town's bazaar. Not knowing what to do, she ends up creating fortunes to tell people. Later, it turns out some of her predictions start to come true.

title: Man of Action
description: Jeff and his friend Smitty seem to have Smitty's little brother tagging along with them. They convince Donna to watch him while they go to visit their girlfriends.

title: Donna Meets Roberta
description: A friend tells Alex a woman is selling her house cheap, but in another year the house value will rise and Alex should consider buying it. Donna meets the woman, a mother like her with children to care for.

title: The Caravan
description: A trip across the country in a recreational trailer turns out to be more work and problems than the enjoyable vacation it started out to be.

title: The Swingin' Set
description: Jeff and Smitty find new girls in town to take to the prom. The two couples attend and have a nice time, but when they switch dates, the evening is magical. Paul Peterson sings Just Keep All Your Love Locked.

title: On to Fairview
description: Jeff gets a job at a bicycle shop to earn spending money. He wants a special gift for his girlfriend. Donna wants him to clean his room before going out so he might lose his job.

title: The Man in the Mask
description: Jeff manages to get an interview with Don Drysdale, an all-star pitcher for the LA Dodgers, for the school newspaper.

title: The Father Image
description: Alex has a patient who needs constant care. Jeff wants his father to help him get his driver's license, and Mary wants him to help repair a pair of shoes she needs for her graduation ceremony.

title: Dear Wife
description: After attending a friend's wedding, Mary seems anxious to get married herself. Alex jokes he'd rather Mary elope and save him the cost of a wedding. Alex and Donna pass it off as a passing fancy until they think she has run off and eloped.

title: Mister Nice Guy
description: Mary clears her room of former treasures as she prepares for college. She finds items belonging to Jeff and yells at him to keep his own items. Jeff takes it calmly. Donna knows something must be up for Jeff not to be in a fighting mood.

title: Mrs. Stone and Dr. Hyde
description: Donna fills in as Alex's nurse while his nurse-receptionist, Alma, is getting married. However, Alex proves to be such a demanding boss that Donna is ready to quit. Things suddenly turn around when a small boy is brought into the office unconscious. Alex and Donna have to forget their differences in order to work together to save his life.

title: To Be a Boy
description: Jeff and Smitty plan not to go on dates so they can save their money to build a sail boat. Mary brings home a friend from college and Jeff forgets his plan.

title: Who Needs Glasses?
description: Jeff's girlfriend is back in town and he cannot wait to see her. However, Angie says she prefers old men and is no longer interested in anyone her age. Jeff decides to wear eye glasses to look older.

title: Mary, Mary Quite Contrary
description: Mary wants her privacy from the family and needs to be independent. She decides to move into a dorm on the college campus, but will she be happy there?

title: My Dad
description: Alex & Jeff enter a father & son golf tournament. Alex is called away by a medical emergency. After several back and forth attempts to spend time together, it seems the day is lost. Jeff loves his father even if he is not always there.

title: Fine Feathers
description: Jeff finds a bird walking on the ground looking daze. He realizes the bird needs to be cared for so he takes it home.

title: Rebel with a Cause
description: Donna takes part in a survey of housewives and the things they do, and is considered a "typical housewife". Donna doesn't like being quantified, and attempts to disprove this.

title: Big Star
description: Mary's new boyfriend has a great singing voice, and she thinks he needs to enter a contest to be recognized for his talent. Mary asks Jeff to help by secretly recording him singing and submitting it to talent agents.

title: Man to Man
description: Alex is pleased when Jeff & Smitty talk him into going camping. Alex thinks it is the perfect for bonding time. It turns out the campsite is near the campsite where Jeff & Smitty's girlfriends are camping.

title: The Baby Buggy
description: Donna wants to help obstetrician Harriet Robey receive recognition for all her years of service to the town. Donna talks the bank into purchasing a car as a gift for Harriet and has it presented at a testimonial dinner.

title: The Makeover Man
description: Mary goes on a date with a guy that is rude and unmannerly, but she decides she is just the person to change him. Every day, Mary works on another part of his personality until he is the way she wants. However, he is no longer himself.

title: The Winning Ticket
description: Jeff enters a raffle where the winning prize is a car. While his ticket did not win, he finds the winning ticket on the ground and claims the car. Now he has to decide whether to keep the car or find the rightful owner.

title: The Soft Touch
description: Jeff is learning how hard it is to ask friends to pay back money he loaned them. Dr Stone has to learn how to collect payments from his patients.

title: Jeff Stands Alone
description: Jeff dawdles while doing his chores and his father compares him to a hard working telephone man. The worker tells Jeff he has it easy and does not know what it is like to be on his own in a strange town. Jeff decides to find out.

title: Just a Little Wedding
description: The Stones are planning a simple wedding for Mary's friend Marcia. When Marcia's mother shows up, everything becomes a big production.

title: A Woman's Place
description: Donna is happy when a woman's club ask her to run for town council. Mary and Jeff help out at home while Donna campaigns. The household does not run smoothly and the family wants Donna back at home.

title: The Chinese Horse
description: Donna attends an auction of unclaimed freight and an unknown woman asks Donna to bid on a Chinese horse. Donna wins the auction but the woman disappears. Donna brings the item home, but then strange things begin to happen.

title: The New Look
description: Mary returns from a date feeling a bit miffed when her boyfriend calls her wholesome. She decides to change her looks to be more exciting.

title: A Way of Her Own
description: A young girl follows the Stone's home after a family outing. When the Stone's find out her parents are dead, they adopt Trisha. With this episode, Paul Peterson's real life sister joins the cast.

title: Three Is a Family
description: Trisha is now part of the family and fits in easily. Jeff enjoys playing with her, and Donna likes having another child to care for. Mary realizes she is the one stuck with babysitting Trisha instead of going on dates.

title: Big Sixteen
description: Jeff is upset that his girlfriend plans a pajama party on the same night as his sixteenth birthday party.

title: Pioneer Woman
description: Alex and Jeff wake up early to go camping with their friend Red. As Donna sees them out the door, Red comments that women cannot go camping because they are too soft. Donna tells Mary they are going camping with the guys to prove Red wrong.

title: The House on the Hill
description: Donna and the woman club are raising money for the children's clinic. Out of ideas for donations, Donna says she will visit an elderly woman in what is reported to be a haunted house.

title: Where the Stones Are
description: Mary wants to vacation with her friends on spring break to a resort. Donna & Alex reluctantly agree, but decide to secretly spy on her to make sure she is OK.

title: The Two Doctors Stone
description: Alex tells Donna that they should get away for the weekend, but Donna is hesitant to leave the children. Donna thinks Trish is coming down with a cold, but it turns out Jeff is the one who gets sick.

title: Everywhere That Mary Goes
description: A young teen is interested in Mary and cannot understand why Mary does not want to go on a date with him. He follows her everywhere with puppy love eyes.

title: The Handy Man
description: Donna hires a handyman who is not so handy.

title: Friends and Neighbors
description: A pediatrician friend of Alex's moves into the house next to the Stones. Dave & Midge are new to setting up a house.

title: Boys and Girls
description: Both Mary and Jeff are looking forward to the upcoming dace. Mary has plans with Scotty, and Jeff has plans with Becky. But when they get to the dance, it seems Scotty & Becky only have eyes for each other.

title: All Those Dreams
description: Donna and Jeff accompany Alex to Chicago where he has a medical conference. They plan to attend the baseball game on the weekend because Don Drysdale is playing. Jeff is unable to get in touch with Don and is disappointed.

title: All Women Are Dangerous
description: Some girls at school compete with each other to see who Jeff will ask to a school dance.

title: Big Wheel
description: Jeff buys an old school bus and intends to make money by driving his friends wherever they want to go.

title: Day of the Hero
description: Jeff invites two girls to the school prom and does not know how to un-ask one of them.

title: The Combo
description: Jeff Stone starts a musical group with some friends.

title: Something Funny Happened on the Way to the Altar
Will the Real Chicken Please Stand Up?
Neither a Borrower Nor a Lender Be
Now You See It, Now You Don't
Do Me a Favor, Don't Do Me Any Favors
Slipped Disc
description: Jeff's rock band plays at a local party, and a cute girl asks them if they've ever thought about making a record. They decide they should, and set out to get enough money to buy recording equipment. They decide to sell shares of stock in their "record company" to all the kids at school. Howevever, things don't turn out exactly as planned.

title: Never Look a Gift House in the Mouth
So You Really Think You're Young at Heart?
